alert.note: Alert for City of Martinsville; Franklin; Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 1:02PM EDT until June 19 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .A north to south band of thunderstorms will bring more rain to the area through the afternoon. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in north central North Carolina, Rockingham, Stokes and Surry. In Virginia, City of Martinsville, Floyd, Franklin, Henry and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 101 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ararat River, Anglin Branch, Beaver Creek, Baker Branch, Belews Creek, Back Creek, Bassett Branch and Archies Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Rocky Mount... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

area.areaDesc: City of Martinsville; Franklin; Henry; Patrick
